channel.title: Bass on Ksbigbass
channel.description: Recent content in Bass on Ksbigbass

item.title: HumminBird Cheat Sheet
item.description:
Quick cheat sheet for Humminbird connectors and network gear.

@ksbigbass

item.title: How To: Swimbaits
item.description:
Brian LATIMER breaks down swimbaits.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XOLpcT4nmWY

Are you new to swimbaits? Confused as to what to use or even how and when to use them? Brian breaks it all down for you in this video. The sizes to use, and when and why he does it, along with the basics in how to fish them. What is great is he is able to make a instructional video and leaves the sales pitch on the bank.

item.title: 3..no wait, Two Pretty Girls Fighting Over You!
item.description:
This sure feels like a couple of hot girls are fighting over me, vying for all my attention.

I had three chasing me but 1 of them was beaten up by a big bully. She’s trying to get all cleaned up and get back in the game, but she’s always kinda been the 3rd choice anyway…

The big bully bought off one of them, stole half of the other’s stuff, just like he does with his baits, and is attempting to take over the pond.

item.title: 3 Best Winter Bass Baits
item.description:
3 Best Top Performing Winter Bass Baits for Largemouth bass.

Across the country, more big fish are caught in cold water than any other time of year. I’ve put together a list of the best cold-water conventional tackle bass baits out there that are commonly found in anglers tackle box.

Suspending Hard Plastic Jerkbaits

  1. Hard Jerkbaits that suspend perfectly in cold water like the LuckyCraft pointer, Spo Mcstick, and the all-time favorites Megabass 110 or a Rapala Husky Jerk.

item.title: Winter largemouth bass fishing
item.description:
The cold water is your friend when hunting for big largemouth bass.

Winter largemouth bass fishing.

Cold Water means big fish.

When the air temps are chilly or downright cold you might be missing out on some big bass opportunities if you are not on the water. While their out hunting, you can have the lake and giant bass all to yourself.

Big bass like cold water. If you go back through the record books and analyze the time of year that most of the giant bass entries are made, the water is cold more times than not. It goes to show that in the spring or in the winter the biggest bass are more available to those anglers willing to put the time in when the temps are uncomfortable.

item.title: Ranger Boats: Road Armor Trailer Axle Problems
item.description:
Very common, unfortunately, a know bad weld exists on the early road armor trailers.

The biggest issue was with the single axle trailers for the 188’s and the 519’s but also with the tandem trailers.

This could save a life. As “new to me” owners should be aware of this important safety issue.

2004-2010 years mainly affected.

Broken Trailer Axle on this Ranger 520 bass boat.

Check the welds on the axles see if there is any visible cracking or separation.

item.title: FLW Losing?
item.description:
Is FLW losing the race for live view fans? More importantly are they losing the fight for fans?

Social media is full of fans that want to watch live streaming bass fishing! We Love Bass Fishing! Streaming live fishing is quickly becoming an addiction for some, myself included.

Is the FLW losing fans?

As I sit here watching both the MLF Bass Pro Tour on one screen and BASS on another I wonder, why isn’t FLW broadcasting live?

item.title: MLF Fishing Scale
item.description:
Fishing Scale: ElectroSamson Brecknell 

The MLF fishing scale: If you were wondering what that scale really looked like? This is the scale that has made the quick catch and release style tournament fishing the success it is. Now any club that wants to try and create their own MLF style tournament knows where to start.

[]

If you like the way the MLF weighs the fish and then immediately releases it, then you are a fan of this scale.

item.title: What’s the best fishing advice you’ve ever received?
item.description: I’ve put together a list of six of the most popular tidbits of fishing advice from seasoned anglers across the web. Never stop learning new things. So many good fishermen out there and every one of them has something to teach us. Tell us below what’s your best advice you’ve received?

item.title: A Better Ned Head
item.description:
A Better Ned Head, seems like we are all looking for a better Ned Rig setup. We’ve all been there. That little TRD worm catches a giant bass and the hook bends, breaks, or is too small and we lose the fish of a lifetime.

Berkley Half Head is rapidly becoming a goto in my tackle box.

Berkley Half Head Fishing Jigs

item.title: Bassmaster Elite at Lake Hartwell
item.description:
Bassmaster Elite at Lake Hartwell: April 4th, 2019. Professional Fisherman Visit Anderson,SC

Anderson, SC at Lake Hartwell.

Just off of I-85, at the South Carolina-Georgia border

56,000-acre

Fishing in this area is renowned by anglers across the state.

The lake is inhabited by striped and hybrid bass, largemouth, crappie, bream and catfish

Weather - Conditions

Sunny - No Wind

Air Temps - 50’s Water Temp - 55+

Topwater Action for schooling fish.

Fish are being caught on topwater walking plugs for schooling spotted bass eating blueback herring that is found in the lake. Fish are spitting up the blueback herring as the anglers are bringing them to the surface.

item.title: What's on that graph?
item.description:
What’s on that graph? We have all said that one.

What’s on that graph? Fishing graphs are absolutely amazing pieces of hardware. Think about the abuse these things take. You would never leave an Ipad sitting outside in the temperature extremes you do with your fish finder. Much less strap it to the extreme environment of a boat going down the lake at 70 + mph. Takes a licken….

Learn what to look for on your fishfinders during the summer to find active fish that are readily available to bite. Once a school gets excited the action can last for hours. Actual pictures of on the water fish catches on the screen, just like a video game.

item.title: 10 Highest Searched Cities For Bass
item.description:
10 Highest Searched City For Bass: Compiled below is a list of the most search cities for bass fishing in the United States. Added are the top lakes in the region for monster bass. #1 on the list is Chapmansboro and the gigantic spotted bass that the Cumberland River has become known for.

10 Highest Searched Cities For Bass terms:

Map toggles with controls on bottom right.

1.Chapmansboro

The Cumberland River is renowned for its fish.

item.title: Powroznik’s MLF: Wins Shearon Harris Reservoir
item.description: MLF: Powroznik wins Major League Fishing stage 3 earning him the title of Bass Pro Tour Stage Three Champion. 63 - 04 was his final total weight. Landed 20 fish during the day with an average of 3.03 lbs and today’s biggest whopper was a badly needed 6.04.

item.title: Dead or Blown Powerhead
item.description:
Dead or Blown Powerhead: It has happened again.

Optimax blew up.

Dead and blown powerhead: So many of us have been there. Whether or not we get a warning buzzer that tells us or just a gut feeling, we all know when we’ve blown up another outboard motor.

item.title: MLF or BASS or FLW
item.description:
MLF or BASS or FLW: The new season is here!

And a lot of changes have taken place over the off season. Seems like the new format of the MLF has taken over the bass fishing world. All the top level tour events have adopted some sort of catch and release system or soon will for the tournaments.

This is great for the conservation of the species and will cut down on mortality rates for sure. There’s no doubt that riding around in a livewell for up to 8 hours and then being put into weigh-in bags and flopped on a scale can be harmful to the days catch. If you’re anything like me you might miss the slaunches being held up on stage and the dramatic endings of the weigh-ins but doesn’t the long term health of the bass deserve more than that?

item.title: Top 10 Bass Fishing Lures of 2015
item.description:
Top 10 Bass Fishing Lures 2015: When looking for the next lure to tie on consider something off this list to increase the odds in your favor. Compiled below is a list of the top selling baits of 2015 and continue to stay on top of the leaderboard of personal best big fish by anglers around the globe.

Top 10 Bass Fishing Lures of 2015

Lucky Craft Pointer 100

item.title: Alaska: Number 1 in Bass Fishing Searches
item.description:
Alaska: Number 1 in Bass Fishing Searches: Google Search Trends showed a big surge in bass fishing related search terms back in 2004 for Alaska. The graph spikes at 100. Instinct tells me this was more for a search for Rock Bass or Striped Bass versus largemouth or smallmouth bass. Either way interesting information for you to enjoy.

Alaska: Number 1 in Bass Fishing Searches

Catching giant striped bass or giant trout on a fly line would be a blast if you ask me. Can’t wait for my first trip to the winding rustic rivers of Alaska to catch some giants on a Spey rod!

item.title: Buddy Tournament Fishing is it for You?
item.description:
Buddy Tournament Fishing is it for You?

The past few years I’ve been fishing buddy tournaments. I went into fishing these buddy tournaments with apprehension.

Would they be good ‘ole boys with a case of Bud in one hand and Zebco in the other or would they be guys as competitive as me? Let me tell you, I was happy to find out these guys are ultra-competitive. They’ll put a whoopin’ on you in a heartbeat and not think twice about it.

item.title: How I fish bluff walls for bass. Bluffed Again:
item.description:
Bluffed Again:How I fish bluff walls for bass: With all of the advances in electronics these days it’s easy to get lazy, and use the map in your Lowrance Elite-12 or the Hummingbird in your dash. Don’t get me wrong, these are invaluable pieces of technology that help anglers find the fish, especially with the newer side and down imaging technologies.

River Channel

When the lake that you are fishing goes for miles and miles, with a lot of the same structure or cover, you have to look for something special. With docks it could be the front left corner or the ones with ladders that put a pattern together. When confronted with a bluff wall 2 miles long or a lake filled with them, to find fish, I find the river channel.

item.title: Shinichi Fukae wrecks his boat
item.description:
Shinichi Fukae wrecks his boat: Professional bass fisherman, Shinichi Fukae and his cameraman were injured Sunday afternoon

June 22, 2011.

Shinichi Fukae wrecks his boat

Paris Post-Intelligencer Shinichi Fukae wrecks his ride

Shinichi Fukae tournament boat crashed into a concrete pillar of the Ned McWherter Bridge at Paris Landing State Park.

item.title: NRX 803S JWR Drop Shot Rod
item.description:
The G. Loomis NRX 803S JWR drop shot rod and the NRX 852S JWR  have been awesome additions to my arsenal.

Both have enough flex in the tip and the right parabolic bend to launch light drop shot rigs into the wind when it’s needed but these are drop shot specific rods.

Weightless Worms

They are not the best for ned rigs or shaky heads. Grab a Mossyback or something else for that presentation that needs a hookset. These rods take surges of a fish very well, absorbs the shock immensely well.

item.title: Become a PAA Observer, win some free stuff.
item.description:
Become a PAA Observer, win some free stuff.

PAA is always having tournaments and looking for official observers to participate in the tournaments. This is a chance to land some free gear!

Plus watch some awesome pro bass fisherman practice.

Why You would Do this?

Learn new tips not available to the general public straight from the pros as they’re using the technique.

https://youtu.be/1m-CRHHw9Eo

Home of the Professional Anglers Association: PAA

item.title: Where to Start
item.description:
Where to Start: Wow! Where do you start ?

Figuring out where to start can send a lump to our stomachs some days. That can be the first feeling that comes over a person when they encounter a lake the size of Table Rock.

Table Rock Lake Shell Knob Bridge

Billions of gallons of water for those green ghost to hide in.  Even if you have been to the lake 50 or 1000 times before,   you still have to answer that question.

item.title: Go Eat a Bird!!!
item.description:
Go Eat a Bird!!! Bought a Save Phace now I am glad I did after reading a friends blog.

The story goes like this. Guy has a fast bass boat like a lot of us do. Running loaded down fairly well on a lake with heavy boat traffic that day. The pair were flying down the lake headed off to the next spot. That is when a group of coots surprisingly came out of nowhere. One of the biggest and slowest birds hit the trolling motor with the boat going about 70 miles and hour. Another bird hit the console and then hit the driver directly in the face.

item.title: OMG! Smallie!!!!
item.description: OMG! Smallie!!!! Was lucky enough to film an incredible smallie show this past week where we had several fish over 6 lbs and 5 fish we weighed over 5 lbs on a digital scale, all on a variety of baits from jerkbaits, jigs, cranks, and lipless cranks.

item.title: S.O.B. Lures: A Passing of a Great
item.description:
Link

S.O.B. Lures: A Passing of a Great:
He had a zest for life and lived it the way he wanted.

William Thomas “Bill” Dee, owner/creator of “S.O.B. Lures” formerly of Austin, Texas, passed away Wednesday, May 18th at his home in Lytle, Texas.

Bill was a former Austin Firefighter, fire investigator for Rimkus Consulting.

He enjoyed many hobbies in his life including motocross, softball and bass fishing. His lure company allowed him to do what he loved: fish, meet people, and tell stories.

item.title: What about the Stalkers KVD?
item.description:
What about the Stalkers KVD?

 Great Video where KVD talks about using a topwater popper!

May is a great time to start throwing topwater baits, start in 60 degree surface water temp and I always start with a Pop-r.

https://youtu.be/i-lA3KkqES0

This video is such a great piece of info from one of the best.

But one big thing I think KVD fails to mention in this video is to watch for stalkers!

item.title: End of a Marathon
item.description:
End of a Marathon: Sure we all have had one of those days.   Well today was Tourney day.   After a long day of work Friday we ended up in Lawrence around 9pm, just in time to find out it was KU’s Graduation Weekend.  

End of a Marathon: Have you ever had one of those days where things went wrong.

The scramble was on to find a hotel room!  

First stop was a no-go, and we quickly came to the realization that we might be spending the night in the truck at the ramp.  As luck would have it the very first hotel  we called had an available room.  We promptly made it to our room after check in and settled in ready for the derby wake up at 04:30.

item.title: Buzzbait conditions
item.description:
Buzzbait conditions: The conditions were perfect for a buzzbait bite — post-frontal with a nice chop on the water, just enough to break up the profile of my bait. It was a textbook presentation.

I want the bass to eat topwater baits but I am not sure the conditions will allow, but if it does….Wow!

Buzzbait conditions:

When to:

Low skies, low light, and a slightly cooler day than you’ve been having, the topwater bite turns on

item.title: Bassmasters Niggemeyer saves man and toddler
item.description:
Bassmasters James Niggemeyer saves man and his toddler on Lake Murray.

Bassmasters Niggemeyer saves man and toddler: On Thursday, the first day of the Bassmaster Evan Williams Bourbon Carolina Clash on Lake Murray, James Niggemeyer, a Bassmaster tournament fisherman and his Marshal, Russ Sorrells, were speeding to a fishing spot when they saw something they only ever heard about.

Lake Murray May 14, 2011 at 3:05 AM EDT - Updated June 24 at 2:54 AM

item.title: Don't Fish In the Trees : The Fishing Wire
item.description: Don’t Fish In the Trees : The Fishing Wire: One of the best pro’s in the business Todd Faircloth breaks down how we are wasting our time fishing the trees. Most often the fish are related to the area because of contours and depth or time of year, the trees just happen to be cover for them. Check out what Todd has to offer you for your next adventure to that tree riddled lake and endless list of targets.

item.title: Underspin: Here's a better look
item.description:
Underspin. Here’s a better look. Turns out I was ahead of the curve on this one.

Casey Ashley won the Bassmaster Classic on a very similar bait.

underspin: here’s a better look

item.title: Clinton
item.description:
Prep for the next tournament at Clinton Lake has begun in earnest now.

Located near Lawrence KS is the next stop for us on this adventure.  

Largemouth and Smallmouth Bass Population

Clinton Lake Wiki

This is a smaller lake here in KS and one that I have never been to.  This is the second tourney in a row that I have never been to the lake at least once.  Add to that, my work schedule did not permit any practice time for this event or the last for that matter.

item.title: The Meat.
item.description:
The Meat.

Today : May 7, 2011 2:53 am

I fished for 2 hrs today in the afternoon.  The weather was the normal 25-40 mph South winds and a warm 76 degrees.
